radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CHD measures 3 mm. There are stones measuring up to 1.5 cm in the distended gallbladder. There is mild gallbladder wall edema. No pericholecystic free fluid. Negative sonographic Murphy sign noted. The head, body, and tail of the pancreas are within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilatation. Spleen normal echogenicity, measuring 8.6 cm. Right kidney limited views show no hydronephrosis, measuring 10.1 cm. The visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits. The aorta measures 2.36 cm in the proximal portion, 2.05 cm in mid portion, and 1.62 cm in the distal abdominal aorta. There is mild calcified atherosclerotic plaque.
